ygData.subject: Re: on training past jade/silver and some other st uff
ygData.msgSnippet: I started working with electrum and malachite immediately after jade (38 skill). I am now at 53 and still have not received a trivial message on them. I
ygData.messageBody:
I started working with electrum and malachite immediately after jade (38
skill). I am now at 53 and still have not received a 'trivial' message on
them. I succeed better than half the time and my skill is skyrocketing. Hope
your luck with it will be as good as mine has been.

> -----Original Message-----
> From: mark Prescott [SMTP:prescotm@...]
> Sent: Thursday, June 03, 1999 5:51 PM
> To: eqenchanters@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [eqenchanters] on training past jade/silver and some
> other stuff
>
> From: "mark Prescott" <prescotm@...>
>
> just a quick question, I was oninions or stats (if anyone has kept track
> or
> tested it) ,
>
> If I am at 40 jewelcraft, and want to train higher (only so I dont fail so
> much on Jade...) will it be cheaper to train with the next stone (pearl I
> think) and silver at 6 plat or so per attemptor with electrum and
> malachite
> (or whatever the cheapest stone is) withc would run about 2plat 5 gold per
> attempt I guess what I am asking when it comes down to it...will failures
> with a stone that is out of my league raise my skill? and how far outta my
> league is that first gem and electrum.
>
> on a side note...anyone have a list or know a site that has the points at
> which all the blacksmithing items become trivial?
>
> Tildin
> Level 10
> Enchanter Extraordinaire
> Tunare Server
>
>
> ------------------------------------------------------------------------
> Looking to expand your world?
